website_summaries.verdict: A deluxe document camera that makes life easier for professionals.
pros: A long list of helpful features

customer_reviews.title: Not 1080p video
customer_reviews.text: Images are 1080p, videos are only 720p. This is not what I was looking for. Everything in the description says 1080p or high def video. Buried in the manual that came with the unit it says maximum of 30fps, 720p video. No response from the sender when I asked about it.
customer_reviews.author: Juliana Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I do love it! It has been a life saver in the classroom. Have been using an iPad to mirror but always have issues with the WiFi connection. No more WiFi issues. I like that it’s easy to simple and easy to use, the picture quality isn’t bad. Sometimes I wish I could zoom a little more and have the focus quality better, but overall, it’s the best thing ever for the price! I figured I don’t always zoom since I’m using it to show text but sometimes it takes a little bit of time for the focus feature to adjust, esp. when I hit the “focus” button.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for Document Scanning
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the DC-21 primarily to use as a document scanner while doing research in university libraries. We found that the image quality (for PDFs) is very poor - fuzzy at best, problems with glare, auto-focus often just a bit off the mark - manual adjustment required. Doubtless it is great for its other intended uses such as classroom projection, but other document cameras that don't handle those tasks as well have better scan-to-file capabilities and editing/cropping features.
customer_reviews.author: TTW

customer_reviews.title: Only works with Epson projectors
customer_reviews.text: We bought 8 of these and the only one that our IT person could get to work is the one with an epson projector. They wouldn't communicate with any other projectors or laptops. :(
customer_reviews.author: Larri Wright

customer_reviews.title: terrific equipment
customer_reviews.text: very helpful to project images to a flat-screen TV, in order for a low-vision elderly reader to read again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rocke

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with macOS catalina
customer_reviews.text: Once my computer upgrade to Catalina MCOS, it is not supported
customer_reviews.author: Francisco J. Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Problematic installation
customer_reviews.text: Was unable to successfully connect this to my MAC despite it supposedly being MAC friendly. Don’t know if the model was defective or it was a software issue but I returned it and bought an Ipevo instead which works beautifully
customer_reviews.author: Strange fungus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent document camera
customer_reviews.text: The microscope attachment is a little disappointing but otherwise this is an excellent document camera. Great zoom and clear picture.
customer_reviews.author: Missybier

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and crisp. Have not tried it for video ...
customer_reviews.text: Elegant and crisp. Have not tried it for video capture though.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is really a nice document camera. I am very satisfied with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zoom feature doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Bought one and the zoom feature didn’t work so I returned it and bought it again- again the zoom feature didn’t work Tried to contact the manufacturer but never had a response Don’t buy
customer_reviews.author: Lori L. Sheets

customer_reviews.title: At least you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Software is hard to find and not well designed. The hardware is nice no compliants for it. Wish software was more user friendly and capable.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S.

customer_reviews.title: Produces poor still images
customer_reviews.text: Produces poor still images. Does not even offer the possibility of cropping still images before being taken. Similar products (which are much cheaper by the way) usually offer more features and give better results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite feature is the one-button record function -- video and ...
customer_reviews.text: The zoom works flawlessly. Never blurs or softens. It's quite stunning. My favorite feature is the one-button record function -- video and audio. 1080p with HDMI connection. This is nice if you want to rehearse, make lessons available for future use, or upload to YouTube. Another nice feature is the ability to mark and annotate. We often work with historical or otherwise one-of-a-kind documents that shouldn't be altered, so this is a nice way to mark on a document without altering the original. Nice with paintings as well to draw attention to brushstrokes and other difficult -to-see details.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for creating whiteboards animations!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for creating whiteboards animations! It records high quality video and sound. It's heavy but it comes with a custom bag with all the right compartments. I also hooked it up to my projector via HDML and it was very useful for giving presentations. This is a great document camera and I find myself using it more and more.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Collins

customer_reviews.title: No wide screen and the "microscope" function is not good
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is a compact document camera. The focus and image quality are great. I do not like the software that comes with the projector. It is just too much. The image is square so it does not take advantage of a classroom-sized monitor that is widescreen. The microscope attachment is not as nice or as easy to use as other "real" camera microscopes. If my school did not pay for it, I would have liked to return it/exchange it for something else.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my first camera of this type, but after much research, I've found that for $500 this camera should have a better quality, and more features that are offered by others in this class of cameras. It does work if its your last result. Images could be clearer, but again, it will work if its all you have, however, for this price point, I'd expect so much more from this machine, and that leaves me a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ymjauthor

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy to carry around
customer_reviews.text: Good quality resolution and easy to use. if you're familiar with other Epson projection appliances you'll feel right at home with the interface. The whole unit folds down into a a little block that fits nicely into its own carry bag. Epson has always made it easy to carry the equipment you need with you. The bag has room for everything you will need to operate the document cam.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great for teachers
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been the big user of this. It was a little complicated as a document camera though. She has mostly used it as a live compact digital overhead projector. Using a rocket notebook or picture like an overhead projector to display on a smart board. Although maybe not it's original purpose she loves it and other teachers always ask about it.
customer_reviews.author: MATT A

customer_reviews.title: Good versatile document camera
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use the Epson DC-07 Portable Document Camera along with the Epson Projector EX3260 we connect it using the usb directly with the projector for use outside during warm weather. It can also be hooked up to the laptop (we had a Dell PC). Perfect for homeschooling, classroom, bible study, or anyone in a teaching/instructor capacity. The DC-10 model has a microscope adapter. Can’t wait for these types of electronics to become Bluetooth enabled.
customer_reviews.author: Parker-Moore Family

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy set up, easy use
customer_reviews.text: Decent document camera, good quality, not the highest resolution, but good for what I needed it for. Easy set up, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: JDuB

customer_reviews.title: Work well for our needs
customer_reviews.text: We use this for church stuff. It works well and it's easy to use. My big complain is that it's not 1080 But it works fine enough and I like it
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: My favorite part about this camera is the zoom
customer_reviews.text: My favorite part about this camera is the zoom! It works great and the picture stays perfectly clear. All the features work well. The microscope was a little foggy but I cleaned it and it worked much better. This product works exactly as described and if your looking for a good, easy to use document camera this is the best one on the market in my opinion. I wouldn’t change anything about it!
customer_reviews.author: KWJ

product_meta.title: Epson DC-21 High-Definition Document Camera with HDMI, 12x Optical Zoom, 10x Digital Zoom and 1080p Resolution
product_meta.description: Style:DC-21 - 1080p, 12x Optical ZoomEngage students like never before with the Epson DC-21 document camera. This portable performer easily captures and displays books, 3D objects and experiments with amazing clarity, thanks to HD 1080P resolution, a Large imaging sensor and HDMI connectivity. Share the finest detail with 12x optical Zoom and 10x digital Zoom. Or, display magnified images with the Microscope Adapter. Record audio with video using the built-in microphone. At 30 fps, video playback is Seamless. And, there are convenient freeze and capture buttons. Plus, you can save lessons to an SD card or computer.
feature_bullets: HDMI digital connectivity for hi-def video

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars69 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
